# Title
China Development Bank provides $25 million loan to Central Bank of Sri Lanka for development

# Description
On July 25, 2009, China Development Bank finalized a $25 million loan agreement with the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) for the purpose of enhancing liquidity in the market and promoting the development of agriculture and infrastructure in Sri Lanka. The loan aimed to "to promote financial and economic co-operation between the two institutions."  This loan agreement carried the following terms: 3 year maturity and an interest rate of 6-month LIBOR plus a 4% margin. Given that the 6-month LIBOR rate in July 2009 was 0.299 %, the total interest amounted to 4.299%.

description: On July 29, 2008, China Eximbank and the Government of Sudan signed a $3 billion oil-backed master framework agreement (or line of credit) to finance various infrastructure projects (as captured via Umbrella Project ID#57039). This 'resources-for-credit' cooperation package is backed by future revenues from the sale of oil exports. Each subsidiary buyer’s credit loan (BCL) issued through the framework agreement carries a 15-year maturity and 5.6% interest rate.  One of the subsidiary loans approved through this agreement in 2009 was a $612,305,397 BCL for the 405 MW Al-Fulah Gas-Fired Power Plant Construction Project.
